actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

committees.committee: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

official_title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to postpone the effective date of high-impact rules pending judicial review.
short_title: Require Evaluation before Implementing Executive Wishlists Act of 2021

summary.text:
Require Evaluation before Implementing Executive Wishlists Act of 2021 or the REVIEW Act of 2021

This bill prohibits a final agency rule from taking effect until (1) the agency submits the rule to the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs (OIRA), and (2) OIRA makes a determination as to whether the rule is a high-impact rule that may impose an annual cost on the economy of at least $1 billion.

In addition, an agency must postpone the effective date of a high-impact rule until the final disposition of all actions seeking judicial review of the rule.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to postpone the effective date of high-impact rules pending judicial review.
Require Evaluation before Implementing Executive Wishlists Act of 2021
